intro: Tristellateia stenactis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star-tongue, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its unique, star-shaped leaves and small, pale yellow flowers. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical significance lies in its limited distribution and distinctive morphology. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered, making conservation efforts crucial for its survival.
